description: Minnesota musician Alexander Craig captivates crowds with his high-energy fusion of rock ‘n’ roll, soul, punk and blues, inspiring dancers with a timeless rock beat. His newest music focuses on progression and perseverance, while touching on positive life philosophy and personal growth.
name: Alexander Craig

description:
America’s favorite stunt dogs are returning to make a splash at the 2024 State Fair! From large to small breeds, these dogs will mesmerize you as they compete in challenges, dock dives and leaps into the air to catch flying discs, plus astounding stunts such as jumping rope, walking backwards and doing paw-stands. These canine stars are thrilling the nation – you may recognize them from “The Tonight Show,” “The Ellen DeGeneres Show,” “The Queen Latifah Show,” Animal Planet, National Geographic, the Rose Parade and television commercials. All-Star Stunt Dogs Splash participated in the “World Dog Awards” hosted by George Lopez on the CW, where jump-rope dog "Spitfire Spinelli" was one of the top three trick dogs on the show! What makes these stunt dogs so special? Besides their talent for flipping, jumping and diving, these amazing pooches have been adopted from shelters across the country and turned into stars. Their mission is to promote pet adoption and spaying and neutering, while encouraging responsible pet ownership. The louder you cheer, the more air the dogs get and the bigger the splash! Come join the “Dog-Gone Fun” happening daily.

ASL interpretation daily at 2 p.m.
name: All-Star Stunt Dogs Splash

description:
In the whimsical world of Alléz-OOPS! with Rob Lok, creativity and comedy come together to make an unforgettable experience. Blending circus thrills, deft pacing and spontaneous comedy, this high-octane slapstick spectacle excites all audiences with absurd sight gags, visual silliness and boundless joy.

ASL interpretation during 3:30 p.m. show.
name: Alléz-OOPS! Circus. Comedy. Spectacle.

description: Minneapolis-based group Alma Andina combines traditional South American instruments with Latin rhythms and danceable styles, such as cumbia, salsa, folk, guajira, Latin rock and reggae. Inspired by a love of folklore, these musicians have been sharing Latin American music and the rich cultural heritage of the Andes with Twin Cities audiences for more than a decade.
name: Alma Andina

description: Genre-bending singer-songwriter Ben Goldsmith commands the stage with his broad, melody-driven and soulful musical palette and multidimensional artistry that transcends format and genre. With a natural yet extraordinary gift for singing, songwriting and performing, this young artist is blazing his own trail in the world.
name: Ben Goldsmith

description: Led by dynamic baritone Jay Ernest, Church of Cash honors the legacy of Johnny Cash while creating an unforgettable experience that celebrates the soul of American music. With impeccable musicianship, an electrifying setlist and captivating stories about Cash’s life, the band sweeps audiences up in the energy and emotions of this amazing tribute show.
name: Church of Cash

description: Americana artist Clare Doyle uses a compelling blend of soulful country and rootsy rock to create a mesmerizing live show that brings audiences along for the ride. Incorporating both classic and contemporary sensibilities into her songs, her music runs the gamut from clever and rollicking to gritty and gut-wrenching.
name: Clare Doyle

description: Led by a Native American blues artist of the Navajo Nation from Shiprock, N.M., Corey Medina & Brothers is based in the lands of the Red Lake, Leech Lake and White Earth Nations in northern Minnesota. This blues-rock power trio seeks to spread light to dark and hope to the hopeless with raw, soulful, intimate music and stage presence.
name: Corey Medina & Brothers

description: A gifted vocalist, songwriter and dancer, DiaToti channels the rich African storytelling tradition, invoking genuine emotions with every tune. She masterfully blends African music, accentuating it with the distinctive rhythms of Congolese sounds, ensuring every listener feels the vibrant pulse of Africa.
name: DiaToti

description: Known for performing familiar songs in their special style and with a twist of fun, Doctor Kielbasa is a veteran group of Minnesota musicians who love to play their unique, culturally influenced music that flows from the soul, creating a collective musical energy that is greater than any individual. Plan to dance and sing along to the lively and happy sounds of this popular Polish-style polka band!
name: Doctor Kielbasa

description: Minneapolis-based with roots in northern Minnesota, dynamic singer-songwriter Faith Boblett creates timeless songs with lyrics and instrumentals that reach a wide range of listeners. With authenticity and depth, she continues to develop her own brand of pop, Americana, rock and alt-country.
name: Faith Boblett

description:
Join us as First Avenue Goes To The Fair with Al Church and The Congregation, hosted by Diane Miller. This two-day showcase features a variety of local artists from Minnesota’s music scene. Expect great live music, a few surprises and a lot of local love at the Great Minnesota Get-Together this summer.

Featured on Friday, Aug. 30, are Fanaka Nation, Jake Balistrieri and Sarah Mevissen from Pit Stop, Lars Pruitt from Yam Haus, student 1 and The Foxgloves. Featured on Saturday, Aug. 31, are Anderson Daniels, Ashley Ackerson, Ava Levy, Pop Wagner and REIKI.
name: First Avenue Goes To The Fair

description: Featuring some of the best musicians in the region, country-rock ‘n’ blues band Gregg Hall & The Wrecking Ball prove to be a force in the Midwest music scene. Hailing from the driftless area of southwest Wisconsin, songwriter Gregg Hall returns to his country roots and backwoods upbringing, writing about heartache and the hard times that come from living on the edge of life.
name: Gregg Hall & The Wrecking Ball

description: Established in 2010, Minnesota band Grupo Esplendor Norteño plays traditional music from the northern part of Mexico using drums, electric bass, 10-string guitar and the accordion, which is the main instrument in this music genre. Though the five members of the band come from different musical influences, all are united in their passion for Norteño music.
name: Grupo Esplendor Norteño

description: Wisconsin-based quartet High & Rising plays a unique combination of instruments to bring a fresh groovy sound to bluegrass and folk-Americana music. Their prolific songwriting and uplifting performances are gaining them recognition in the Upper Midwest music scene.
name: High & Rising

description: Envy and Fancy, the Twin Cities-based hip-hop duo known as iLLism, evoke passion and emotions with captivating narratives and empowering lyrics that are accessible to people from all walks of life. Performing a tribute to the Minneapolis Sound, their work spans across various genres, such as hip-hop, R&B, jazz and Minneapolis Funk.
name: iLLism

description: The Midwest’s premier reggae band for more than 20 years, The International Reggae All Stars are truly a global band with members hailing from Venezuela to Trinidad to Ghana to Jamaica. These musicians play reggae, dancehall and Bob Marley classics, while bringing peace, love and positive vibrations with them wherever they go.
name: International Reggae All Stars

description: Expanding the boundaries of the British Invasion, Jiggs Lee Invasion brings to life the vibrant music of the groups that made generations of people fall in love with rock ‘n’ roll. Fronted by highly regarded lead singer Jiggs Lee, this band plays great tunes of the era with impeccable three-part vocal harmony, soaring and shredding lead guitar and a nimble powerhouse rhythm section.
name: Jiggs Lee Invasion

description: Fueled by a passion for old-time rock ‘n’ roll and soul, five-piece show band Jonny Lyons & the Pride brings audiences along on a nostalgic and unforgettable musical experience. A mix of original material and classic hits, the shows are full of electrifying energy from ‘50s and ‘60s sock hops and the soulful sounds of ‘60s and ‘70s R&B and Motown.
name: Jonny Lyons & the Pride

description: Lauded for their dance moves as well as their vocal abilities, Kazual (pronounced “casual”) is a family band of three brothers and a cousin who perform an eclectic mix of old school, Top 40 and originals. In addition to appearing on “America’s Got Talent” and opening for Beyoncé and Kellie Pickler, among others, they perform around the world as musical ambassadors through the U.S. Department of State’s American Music Abroad program.
name: Kazual

description: Kickin’ It Irish thrills with Riverdance-style Irish dancing accompanied by bodhrán, Irish flute, accordion, piano, guitar and fiddle – all with flair, humor and fun. With world-class dancers and an international six-piece band, the live music and championship dancing will have you tapping your toes and flying out of your seat!
name: Kickin' It Irish with O’Shea Irish Dance

description: Interactive kids’ DJ Kidsdance spins the hottest new music and the coolest classics to get kids on their feet dancing and grooving. These upbeat and high-energy shows are the perfect place for family fun.
name: Kidsdance

description: A performing musician, teaching artist and producer from the northside of Minneapolis, L.A. Buckner’s project BiG HOMiE took iTunes by storm, reaching the No. 1 jazz position within 24 hours of its release. Influenced by gospel, R&B, hip-hop, African rhythm and jazz, his fusion of these genres explodes in a fiery journey of syncopation and truth, earning respect from the most-trained musical ear to the everyday music lover.
name: L.A. Buckner & BiG HOMiE

description: Known for his multilayered looped saxophone performances and catchy podcast ditties, LAAMAR is the latest project led by Minneapolis-based singer, songwriter, saxophonist and composer Geoffrey Lamar Wilson. On the band’s debut EP, Wilson blends his idiomatic inspirations bridging folk, soul, R&B and country with a constant ear toward racial and social justice issues and the shared human experience.
name: LAAMAR

description: Explore the hilarious side of hypnosis and discover the amazing power and creativity of the human mind. Compelled to explore the lighter side of the power of the human mind, Lizzy creates a vibrant, high-energy show appropriate for all ages.
name: Lizzy - Comedy Stage Hypnosis

description: Combining Tex-Mex conjunto, Texas rock, blues and R&B riffs, Los Texmaniacs delight audiences with a sound solidly rooted in tradition while exploding with contemporary vitality. The musicians in this Grammy Award-winning quartet champion their musical and cultural heritage with deep, abiding pride and dazzling artistry.
name: Los Texmaniacs

description: A contemporary country artist with a pop-influenced sound and a down-home attitude, Lucas Hoge engages listeners with his warm, evocative vocals and emotional authenticity. A songwriter of considerable depth and a singer with an enviable skill for interpreting a lyric, he has the rare ability to find common ground with just about anyone and draw them into his world.
name: Lucas Hoge

description: Singer-songwriter Mae Simpson writes music with passion, soul and a rawness reflected in each lyric. Backed by an extremely talented and passionate band, her shows consist of an uncontainable energy that radiates from stage with a broad collection of soul, funk and rock-inspired original music that refuses to fall neatly into a single genre.
name: Mae Simpson

description: Music is a powerful means of expression, and rarely has a young performer displayed better command than singer-songwriter Maggie Rose. Unencumbered by genre, she does everything completely and with unflinching honesty. Showcasing a strong, warm voice that is alternately playful or poignant, her gift for penning insightful songs and delivering them with emotional punch is evident. Known for her blend of rock, soul and Americana-folk stylings, she has crafted albums filled with potent songs, each one anchored by her riveting vocals.
name: Maggie Rose

description: Premier American musical ensemble Mariachi Campanas de America fascinates audiences with the ability to combine traditional Mexican mariachi music with Latin and mainstream pop rhythms. These multitalented musicians create innovative mariachi music with the use of accordion, saxophone and keyboard for unmatched versatility, enhancing nontraditional music while preserving the authentic sounds of mariachi music.
name: Mariachi Campanas de America

description: World yo-yo champion and cool guy Mark Hayward makes a career out of playing with toys. With an amusing combination of comedy and object manipulation, he uses yo-yos, spinning tops, juggling equipment and nontraditional props like mousetraps to create a fun and witty show for the whole family.
name: Mark Hayward

description: Best known for the 15 years spent drumming for The Ramones, Marky Ramone performed in more than 1,700 shows and more than 15 releases during his tenure with the band. An American punk rock band formed in New York City, The Ramones are often cited as the first true punk band and are known for helping establish the punk movement. Popular songs in their catalogue include “I Wanna Be Sedated,” “Judy Is a Punk,” “I Wanna Be Your Boyfriend,” “Sheena Is a Punk Rocker,” “Rock & Roll High School” and “Blitzkrieg Bop,” among others. In 2002, the original four members and Marky Ramone were inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in their first year of eligibility, and in 2011, they were awarded a GRAMMY Lifetime Achievement Award. Marky Ramone continues to tour the world with his band, Marky Ramone’s Blitzkrieg.
name: Marky Ramone Plays The Ramones Classics

description: With a broad range of musical experience that infuses each song, Maurice Jacox & We Still R mix jazz, soul, R&B, gospel, big band, rock and pop into a great show. Backed by eight of the top musicians in the Midwest, the vocal power and upbeat personality of legendary vocalist Jacox elevate the mood of everyone.
name: Maurice Jacox & We Still R

description: Equal parts old soul and modern man, McKinley James breathes new life into classic sounds, blending the contemporary with the vintage, erasing the lines between genre and generation. Together with longtime bandmate, father Jason Smay on the drums, he creates a lean, honest version of American roots music that makes room for everything from Motown hooks to roadhouse boogie-woogie.
name: McKinley James

description: Playing hard-hitting dance music, McNasty Brass Band is a collection of Twin Cities-based horn players and percussionists that fuse the Minneapolis Sound with the spirit of New Orleans. Their high-energy live shows feature exciting compositions, rowdy group vocals and rip-roaring solos accompanied by a few dance moves.
name: McNasty Brass Band

description: Featuring The KAJ Orchestra led by Kirk A. Johnson, The Men of Motown presents the music of Stevie Wonder, Smokey Robinson, Marvin Gaye, The Jackson 5, The Four Tops and The Temptations performed by The Mfellaz. The iconic songs in this dynamic and soulful show transport audiences back in time to the creation of Motown’s danceable arrangements and choreography.
name: The Men of Motown

description: Both powerhouse entertainers, Mick Sterling and Cate Fierro have a strong desire to explore new interests and create new projects. In this collaboration, their stellar vocals and magnetic personalities shine as they present a variety of songs from the vast repertoire of the American songbook.
name: Mick Sterling and Cate Fierro

description: A variety show for all ages takes center stage at the Leinie Lodge Bandshell. A State Fair favorite for more than 50 years, the Amateur Talent Contest, sponsored by JPMorgan Chase & Co., features top talent in three divisions: open, teen and preteen. One hundred twenty semifinalists, selected from acts who audition in July, compete for more than $20,000 in cash awards. Winners are chosen nightly Aug. 22 through Aug. 31 for a spot to compete in the Amateur Talent Contest Finals in the Grandstand on Sunday, Sept. 1. Don't miss this State Fair tradition!
name: Minnesota State Fair Amateur Talent Contest

description:
See what happens when Minnesota icons face off in a quiz show hosted by Betty Crocker and when Minnesota’s state symbols stage a fashion show. Returning for the eighth year, History On-A-Schtick is full of family fun, satirical songs and peachy prizes. Written and directed by Beth Gilleland with musical direction by Kevin Dutcher, the cast includes Bonni Allen, Aimee Bryant, Ricky Morisseau and Jim Robinson. This program is presented by the Minnesota Historical Society.

Audio description available for select shows - schedule TBD.
name: MNHS presents History On-A-Schtick

description: Performing with a contagious enthusiasm, bluegrass quintet Monroe Crossing dazzles audiences around the world with an electrifying blend of classic bluegrass, bluegrass gospel and heartfelt originals. The group creates joyful music with clever and compelling arrangements, flawless instrumental work and unique ensemble sound.
name: Monroe Crossing

description: Monster Shop Bump’n is a high-energy show of head-spinning acrobatics and all-out breakdancing that is fun for the whole family. These award-winning breakers have performed throughout the world and for various music videos and television commercials.
name: Monster Shop Bump’n

description: Once again ready to push the boundaries of their genre, Nashville-based indie alt-rock band Moon Taxi is back with a sixth full-length album, “Set Yourself Free.” With tracks ranging from rock to synth to pop to bluegrass, the new lineup showcases what 15 years as a band gets you: a polished, classic sound without fear of exploration. The five band members stepped back into their roots to create an album primarily written and recorded by themselves. Despite a more fragmented process, the band regards “Set Yourself Free” as more reminiscent of their early work, citing it as fresh and exciting. They believe the album will become a fan favorite, something that will re-energize the initial fan base as well as draw in new listeners. Without a set sound in mind, the group was free to mold the record into what feels like an authentic Moon Taxi album.
name: Moon Taxi

description: County fairs throughout Minnesota are invited to send winners of their amateur talent contests to the State Fair competition. Semifinals are held the first nine evenings of the State Fair at the Family Fair Stage at Baldwin Park. First-place semifinals winners progress to the MSF County Fair Talent Contest Finals on Saturday, Aug. 31, the 10th night of the fair.
name: MSF County Fair Talent Contest

description: An internationally known high-energy dance troupe, Native Pride Dancers create beautiful and powerful expressions in movement, sharing stories through dance and song that feature an innovative blend of modern and traditional Native American dance styles. The performers’ rich cultural heritage is also reflected in their authentic regalia that honors the elders and legacy of their nations.
name: Native Pride Dancers

description: Four-time Minnesota Music Award recipients and consistently voted Minnesota’s Best Reggae Band, New Primitives showcases a mixture of percussion-forward funk, rock, reggae and world music. Masters at creating a unique vibe, this talented band’s live shows are legendary, hypnotic, dance-filled events.
name: New Primitives

description: Minneapolis-based steel drum duo Pan Dimensions serenades audiences with Caribbean rhythms, creating a fun, relaxed atmosphere. With a vast repertoire of party favorites refashioned in acoustic steel band arrangements, their colorful music brings a tropical twist to the fair.
name: Pan Dimensions

description: Since his songwriting career blossomed in the mid-‘90s, American country music artist Phil Vassar has accumulated a catalog of signature songs with 10 No. 1 singles and 27 Top 40 hits, including “Carlene,” “Just Another Day in Paradise,” “Six-Pack Summer,” “When I Love You,” and many more. His solo recording career has seen the release of nine albums, two ASCAP Songwriter of the Year trophies, ACM’s Top New Male Vocalist and sold-out shows across the country. His “Songs From The Cellar” airs nationally on Circle Network and features conversations and musical collaborations with artists, songwriters, entertainers and athletes. His laidback style and quick wit bring out interesting and entertaining stories with every guest.
name: Phil Vassar

description: Guitarist, singer and songwriter PK Mayo creates a unique sound all his own with rich vocals, melodic riffs and his natural talent on the acoustic slide and electric guitars. In the PK Mayo Band, he is joined by Steve Lehto on guitar, John Wright on bass and Matt Jacobs on drums for a full-bodied, no-holds-barred approach to his Americana and blues explorations.
name: PK Mayo Band

description: A high-energy show, PopROCKS draws crowds to their feet with top-notch musicianship, powerful vocals, choreography, spot-on impersonations, special effects and lively performances. This dynamic band plays the best of today’s hottest Top 40 hits, throwback hip-hop, pop, country, party rock and timeless classics.
name: PopROCKS

description: Chicago-based Radius creates an unforgettable sonic experience with mesmerizing harmonies, innovative arrangements and loveable personalities. This dynamic five-piece vocal band delights audiences of all ages with electrifying covers of popular songs from oldies to jazz standards to pop ballads and everything in between.
name: Radius

description: Nashville-based country music trio Renata The Band displays strong vocal and instrumental skills far surpassing the ages of these young musicians. With an organic yet driving sound, they create fantastic original music full of their signature sibling three-part harmonies and an energy that comes from the love of performing together.
name: Renata The Band

description: Upon arriving in Minnesota from New York in 1998, a group of young Dominicans formed a musical ensemble called Grupo Caliente, whose performances of merengue and bachata music gained popularity, making them area favorites. In 2003, the group became Rumba Nueva and currently features Carmelo Medina on piano, Leonel Sax on saxophone, Gilbert on the güira, Alexis on timbales and Leo Burdier on lead vocals.
name: Rumba Nueva

description: Rooted in traditional Irish music, Celtic pop-rock band Screaming Orphans draws from a diverse set of influences to focus on melody-driven songs with pop and rock strains and to explore new and exciting songwriting and performance concepts. These four sisters are known for a powerful, award-winning sound that combines their own original melodic old-school pop songs with a unique and modern take on traditional Irish music and song.
name: Screaming Orphans

description: Minneapolis rock band Semisonic, featuring GRAMMY-winning and Oscar-nominated lead vocalist Dan Wilson, John Munson and Jacob Slichter, is best known for the GRAMMY-nominated, massive hit single “Closing Time” and platinum album “Feeling Strangely Fine.” Semisonic also achieved international success with singles “Secret Smile” and “Singing In My Sleep.” Although the band never officially broke up, they parted ways in the early 2000s, periodically reuniting for one-offs and charity performances. During this hiatus, Wilson became one of the most in-demand songwriters in music and a 3x GRAMMY winner for his work with Adele, The Chicks and Chris Stapleton. In 2020, Semisonic reunited to release the band’s first music in 20 years with the critically acclaimed single and EP “You’re Not Alone.” In 2023, they released a full-length album, “Little Bit of Sun,” and toured the U.S. with Barenaked Ladies.
name: Semisonic

description: One of the most respected and accomplished artists in American roots music, Terrance Simien delivers his eclectic music artfully with complex vocal harmonies and a diverse repertoire. He and his highly skilled five-piece band create a hypnotic blend of New Orleans funk-world-blues-American-reggae-flavored zydeco roots music that beckons crowds to their feet and into the groove.
name: Terrance Simien and the Zydeco Experience

description: Stationed in Rosemount, the 34th Infantry Division "Red Bull" Band of the Minnesota National Guard performs throughout the region and world, sharing the story of the Minnesota Citizen Soldier. Proudly serving state and nation for more than 100 years, the unit provides music throughout the spectrum of military operations to instill the will to fight and win, foster the support of citizens, and promote national interests at home and abroad.
name: The 34th Infantry Division “Red Bull” Band

description: An ultimate blast from the past, The 70’s Magic Sunshine Band brings audiences back to the era of 8-tracks, polyester and bell bottoms with the greatest hits from 1970s AM radio. Get ready to boogie down and feel the funky vibes as the band’s high-energy performances fill the dance floor!
name: The 70’s Magic Sunshine Band

description: Delivering a premier Midwest-rooted tribute, The Brothers Allmanac play classics and deep cuts spanning the entirety of The Allman Brothers Band career. From the raw, emotional vocals, the spot-on guitar harmonies and the thundering double drums, audiences feel like they are really listening to The Allman Brothers.
name: The Brothers Allmanac

description: Now in its 35th year, The Cedar Cultural Center promotes intercultural appreciation and understanding though global music and dance. Come explore the vibrancy and diversity of the Twin Cities art scene as The Cedar presents The Global Get-Together with France's favorite Celtic folk-pop band Doolin' on Aug. 28 and the Ethiopian-inspired rhythms and jazz of Abinnet Berhanu's Ahndenet (Unity) featuring Genet Abate on Aug. 29.
name: The Cedar Cultural Center Presents The Global Get-Together

description:
A high-energy, hilarious one-man show, The Chipper Experience! Where Comedy & Magic Collide! is a family-friendly crowd-pleaser. For more than 20 years, award-winning comedy magician Chipper Lowell has been bringing his odd brand of infectiously amusing mayhem to audiences around the world.

ASL interpretation during 3:30 p.m. show.
name: The Chipper Experience! Where Comedy & Magic Collide!

description: Country music husband-and-wife duo The Dryes bring the stage to life with songs that range from rowdy to nostalgic, each one a tiny window into their lives. Proving to be a force to be reckoned with, Derek provides a steady backbone alongside Katelyn’s soulful sound to make music that ranges from upbeat dance tunes to emotional anthems.
name: The Dryes

description: Through years of working together, Brianna and Kurt Jorgensen developed a sound that is powerful and fresh, taking root in rock, blues and Americana soul. Backed by a solid six-piece band, the performances of this husband-and-wife team are genuine, soulful and relatable with an honest authenticity, which is both timeless and classic.
name: The Jorgensens

description: Led by guitarist Robb Henry, The Robb Henry Trio plays an eclectic instrumental mix of jazz, blues, rock and ‘60s pop music. Their songs feature familiar melodies, unexpected excursions and sonic surprises that take listeners on a musical journey.
name: The Robb Henry Trio

description: A collaboration between Daniel Murphy and Jeff Arundel, The Scarlet Goodbye is a musical adventure developed after a chance meeting between the two musicians. With incredible songwriting skills, strong melodies and tight, clean instrumentation, this unlikely duo artfully delivers songs that evoke the emotions of minor things in major keys.
name: The Scarlet Goodbye

description: Emerging as one of the most electrifying new acts in American music, The War & Treaty captivates audiences across the globe, recently earning the act’s first GRAMMY nominations for Best New Artist and Best American Roots Song, as well as a first Duo of the Year nomination from the Country Music Association and a first Vocal Duo nomination from the Academy of Country Music. In addition, this pair has received recognition from the Country Music Hall of Fame, Grand Ole Opry and American Music Association, including earning AMA Duo/Group of the Year for the second year in a row. This powerhouse husband-and-wife duo shares songs of reconciliation and humanity, blending roots, folk, gospel and soul to create music that is chilling, soulful and powerful. With their transcendent vocals, Tanya and Michael Trotter Jr. take listeners on a soaring, emotional ride with a sound that’s both stirring and sensual, driven by joy, determination and an unceasing upward gaze.
name: The War & Treaty

description: Thomasina Petrus is a jazz singer, theater professional and entrepreneur. She is best known for her signature role of jazz icon Billie Holiday. In addition, she is a McKnight Theater Artist Fellow, Ivey Award winner and founder of the theater company Thomasina Productions.
name: Thomasina Petrus & The King's Quartet

description: After 25 years, the Timberworks Lumberjack Show continues captivating spectators with daring feats matching human against the impossible. World-class forest sports athletes compete in a decathlon of timber events designed to challenge even the hardiest lumberjacks. Flannel-clad woodsmen and women showcase their skills in single buck saw, obstacle pole, logroll, hot saw, speed climb and more. From the precision and control required for the axe throw to the power and technique needed for the springboard chop, audience members will see a wide variety of exciting, fast-paced events. Fun for the whole family!
name: Timberworks Lumberjack Show

description: Drawing creative energy from a wide spectrum of rock, soul, jazz and Americana, as well as singer-songwriters, Tina Schlieske has spent years honing her skills, writing songs and playing everywhere she could find a stage and cultivating a dedicated following. Originally hailing from Minneapolis, Minn., she captivates listeners with her impassioned vocal delivery and magnetic stage presence.
name: Tina Schlieske & Friends

description: Although singer-songwriter Tommy Prine grew up surrounded by music, learning fingerpicking from his father, country-folk musician John Prine, at the age of 10 and sometimes joining him on stage, he didn’t seriously consider music as a career until after his father’s death in 2020. Endeavoring to create distinct and independent music from his father, his songs are strong and introspective with a roots-rock edge that builds on established tradition while breaking free from the past.
name: Tommy Prine

description: Award-winning salsa fusion band Tropical Zone Orchestra breathes life into the rich musical heritage of Puerto Rico with swinging salsas, grooving merengues, cumbias and boleros. Their interpretive style and inventive musical flair make them a fast favorite among Twin Cities jazz and salsa fans.
name: Tropical Zone Orchestra

description: With a level of physical prowess and coordination rarely seen in juggling shows, Tuey uses charm, humor and awe-inspiring skill to captivate audiences. His show is a perfect blend of family-friendly comedy, jaw-dropping skills and danger.
name: Tuey

description: Founded in the spirit of collective creativity and experimentation, World Jazz Collegium is an assembly of local and international musicians led by Twin Cities-based guitarist and composer Pavel Jany. In addition to their original compositions, the ensemble’s repertoire includes works by Chick Corea, Herbie Hancock, Carlos Santana, Jeff Beck and other legends of the jazz-rock-fusion era.
name: World Jazz Collegium
